qas.question: What entertainment company purchased Marvel at the end of the 2000s?
When was the sale of Marvel to this entertainment conglomerate announced?
What was the sale price of Marvel?
What is the readership market share enjoyed by Marvel and DC comics?
In 2010, Marvel switched to what distributor for bookstore comic book sales?
What did Marvel Entertainment purchase in 2009?
How much did Disney buy DC for?
What percentage of the American comic-book market did Marvel account for?
When did Marvel switch to Diamond Book Distributors?
How much did DC Comics shareholder receive as a result of the Marvel-Disney deal?

context: On <a1_0>August 31, 2009<a1_0/>, <a0_0><b5_0>The Walt Disney Company<b5_0/><a0_0/> announced a deal to acquire Marvel Comics' parent corporation, Marvel Entertainment, for <a2_0><b6_0>$4 billion or $4.2 billion<b6_0/><a2_0/>, with Marvel shareholders to receive <b9_0>$30 and 0.745 Disney shares<b9_0/> for each share of Marvel they own. As of 2008, Marvel and its major, longtime competitor DC Comics shared over <a3_0><b7_0>80%<b7_0/><a3_0/> of the American comic-book market. As of September <b8_0>2010<b8_0/>, Marvel switched its bookstores distribution company from Diamond Book Distributors to <a4_0>Hachette Distribution Services<a4_0/>.
